member.name: M:WindowsFormsApp1.E2data.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[][],System.String[][],System.Drawing.Color)
member.remark: Most of the work in this class is done by the constructor, which parses the .csv document and initiliazes a list of elements as well as all extensions.
member.param: an upper bound on the number of stems, i.e., x coord (can be large, better safe than sorry)
an upper bound on the max Adams filtration (can be large, better safe than sorry)
In entry n contains all the words for : [0] name, [1] stem, [2] filt, [3] weight, [4] tau torsion, [5] label
In entry n contains all the words for : [0] extension target, [1] extension info, [2] localization

member.name: M:WindowsFormsApp1.E2data.MakeTableOfIndices(System.String[],System.String[][],System.String[][])
member.summary: This method parses the header. It identifies the columns of name, stem, filt, weight and tautorsion, identifies the columns of the extenisons, and links the extension info and the extension target of together
member.param: Array of strings containing the names of the columns in the .csv
In entry n contains all the words for : [0] name, [1] stem, [2] filt, [3] weight, [4] tau torsion, [5] label, [6] angle
In entry n contains all the words for : [0] extension target, [1] extension info, [2] localization

member.name: M:WindowsFormsApp1.E2data.GetExtTarget(WindowsFormsApp1.Element,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Given an element and the index in Extensions of the type of extension, the method returns the extension of the element
member.param: Index in Extensions of the type of extension
The word for an infinite tower of extensions (such as h1-periodic stuff)
member.returns: Returns an int[3] containing (stem, filt, indexAtStemFilt) to locate it in Element. If the value is null, it means TODOOOO

member.name: M:WindowsFormsApp1.Element.#ctor(System.String[],System.Int32[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object[]}@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor for Element whose input is a line from the .csv file as well as a recipe to know what information is where
member.param: The line from the .csv file given as an array of string, cell by cell
The indexes are: [0] name, [1] stem, [2] filtration, [3] weight, [4] tauTorsion
The number of the line in the .csv (have to add 2 to recover the line in the .csv because of the header)
The index of the element in the List at Elements[stem][filt]
List where each object contains (string, int), where the string is the name of the extension element and int is its column in the .csv file and thus in
Boolean indicating wheter or not there is a periodic tower of extensions starting from this element (the extension element should be implicit somehow)

member.name: M:WindowsFormsApp1.Element.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object[]}@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This constructor is only used when I have to create an extra point which does not appear in the .csv file. Usually because there is an infinite tower of extensions so we create one more point

member.summary: Refresh button which redraws the whole diagram (but does not reload the document)

member.summary: Box where you choose the format (and hence the number of pixels) of the document

member.name: M:WindowsFormsApp1.Form1.Zoom_scroll(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Scrolling button to zoom in/out. The minimum zoom is the default size, the maximum is the biggest zoom which does not loose quality.

member.summary: Button to improve the resolution, without changing the format mode
